# Report

## Topic

We were interested in the relevance of OpenAI in media and specifically
The Guardian. We wanted to analyse in which sections this topic came up
the most and how many articles were written about it across time.

## Collecting the Data

We created a developer account to be able to access the data from the
API. Then we retrieved the data with a GET request and parsed it to
extract the relevant information. We ended up with a tibble of 2390
articles, because it failed to fetch data for page 240 and onward. These
were sorted by relevancy.

## Analysis

### Plot

First we created a bar plot to represent the amount of articles in each
section of the newspaper. We found that the topic was most relevant in
the Technology, Sport, Opinion, World news, business and Australia news
sections in descending order.

![](images/Articles_by_Section.png)

### Word Cloud

Additionally, we created a word cloud representing the words most often
mentioned in the articles. Among others these included "open", "new",
"australian" and "review".
